addressLines.description: Address Lines specifies the undefined lines of a geographic address.

cityLocalityName.description: City Locality Name specifies the name of a city, municipality, county or ward. Ex: New York

countryCode.description: Country Code specifies a region or territory.  Ex: US=United States of America  (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format)

countrySubdivisionCode.description: Country Subdivision Code uniquely identifies the divisions used by countries and their major dependent territories.  Ex:  GA=Georgia (US), VIC=Victoria (AU) (ISO 3166-2)

latitudeDegreeNum.description: Latitude Degree Number specifies the latitude in degrees. Ex: 38.8951

longitudeDegreeNum.description: Longitude Degree Number specifies the longitude in degrees. Ex: -77.0364

postalCode.description: Postal Code uniquely identifies a geographical area defined for mail delivery.  Example:  30854-1801=Atlanta, Georgia

Address.title: Address
Address.description: Address represents information pertaining to a physical location at which an entity, person or organization may receive or send communications.

aircraftHeadingDegreeNum.description: Aircraft Heading Degree Number is the compass direction in which the aircraft's nose is pointed. Example: 90=east, 180=south, 270=west, 0 or 360=north

altitudeFeetCnt.description: Altitude Feet Count is the altitude in foot measurement.

altitudeKilometerCnt.description: Altitude Kilometer Count is the altitude in kilometers measurement.

atArrivalPositionCode.description: At Arrival Position Code denotes whether or not the flight arrived at position.

atDeparturePositionCode.description: At Departure Position Code denotes whether or not the flight departed at position.

currentTimeMillisecondCnt.description: Current Time Millisecond Count represents the time in milliseconds.

kilometerPerHourCnt.description: Kilometer Per Hour Count represent the speed in kilometers.

milePerHourCnt.description: Mile Per Hour Count represents the speed in miles.

AircraftPosition.title: AircraftPosition
AircraftPosition.description: Aircraft Position indicates the position of the flight with respect to various parameters.

airportCode.description: Airport Code specifies a geographic location where aircraft arrive and depart.  Example:  LAX=Los Angeles Int.  (IATA format)

elevationFeetCnt.description: Elevation Feet Count specifies the number of feet to a resolution of one foot for the elevation above Mean Sea Level for a location.

Airport.title: Airport
Airport.description: Airport represents a geographic location where aircraft arrive and depart.

airWaybillNum.description: Air Waybill Number is an identifier for the booking and air waybill that is unique for the life of the booking/air waybill. Ex: 00612345678

bookingId.description: Booking Identifier is a system generated unique identifier for the booking

bookingRemarks.description: Booking Remarks is a free text description of the booking (max 125 characters)

hashCode.description: Hash Code is used to verify the integrity of the data object

links.description: Links define additional actions or resources related to the requested action or resource.  For example, a booking resource has a link to the quote resource on which the booking was based

participants.description: Participants are people, entities, or organizations that play a roll on the booking, Examples: Shipper, Agent, Consignee

quoteId.description: Quote Identifier is the identifier of the quote on which this booking was based

rateId.description: Rate Identifier is the identifier for the rate used for the weight charges on this booking

shipmentDesc.description: Shipment Description must contain an accurate explanation of the contents  being shipped (max 50 characters)

statusCode.description: Status Code identifies the current status of the booking. Ex: ACCEPTED

Booking.title: Booking
Booking.description: Booking represents a request for transportation of a cargo shipment

airWaybillNum.description: Air waybill Number is an identifier for the booking and air waybill that is unique for the life of the booking/air waybill. Ex: 00612345678

bookingRemarks.description: Booking Remarks is a free text description of the booking (max 125 characters)

participants.description: Participants are people, entities, or organizations that play a roll on the booking, Examples: Shipper, Agent, Consignee

quoteId.description: Quote Id is the identifier of the quote on which this booking was based

shipmentDesc.description: Shipment Description must contain an accurate explanation of the contents  being shipped (max 50 characters)

BookingRequest.title: BookingRequest
BookingRequest.description: Booking Request is the information needed in order to create a booking

bookings.description: Bookings is an array of bookings representing requests for transportation of cargo shipments

limitNum.description: Limit is used for pagination of results.  The number of records returned is limted to the number provided.  Defaults to 10.

offsetNum.description: Offset is used for pagination of results.  It represents the starting point of the records to return.  Defaults to 1.

totalNum.description: Total identifies the total number of records in the result set

BookingsResult.title: BookingsResult
BookingsResult.description: Bookings Result is the result of a request that can return multiple bookings, and includes pagination information on what was returned

containerDesc.description: Container Description is a free text description of the BUP.

containerQty.description: Container Quantity is the number of BUP containers of the specified type and weight

volumeQty.description: Volume Quantity is the volume of the container

weightQty.description: Weight quantity is the gross weight of the container

BupContainer.title: BupContainer
BupContainer.description: BUP (Bulk Utilization Program) Container represents shipper loaded containers which are transported intact by the carrier

basisCode.description: Basis Code represents the charge basis code. Ex: CHARGEABLE_WEIGHT

basisQty.description: Basis Quantity represents the charge basis quantity

chargeAmt.description: Charge Amount represents the charge amount as determined by the rate amount applied to the unit basis

chargeCode.description: Charge Code represents the charge code

chargeDesc.description: Charge Description is a textual description of the charge

chargeType.description: Charge Type is the type of the charge. Ex: CONTRACT

currencyCode.description: Currency Code identifies a medium of exchange which allows for the translation of different-valued denominations of money across the world. Example: USD=US Dollar (ISO 4217 format)

loadTypeCode.description: Load Type Code represents the load type. Ex: Bulk

paymentLocationCode.description: Payment Location Code represents where payment is made. Ex: Origin

paymentMethodCode.description: Payment Method Code represents the payment method type. Ex: Debit

rateAmt.description: Rate Amount represents the rate that is applied to the unit basis in order to determine a charge.

rateId.description: Rate Id uniquely identifies a rate

unitCode.description: Unit Code represents the unit measure. Ex: FLAT

Charge.title: Charge
Charge.description: Charge represents the cost of a service billed to a customer and the criteria that is used to determine that cost

contactName.description: Contact Name is the name of an entity, person or organization. Ex: Joe Willis

emailAdr.description: Contact Email Address is the email address by which an entity, person or organization may be contacted. Ex: joe.willis@gmail.com

phoneNum.description: Phone Number is the phone number by which an entity, person or organization may be contacted. Ex: 641-754-3010

Contact.title: Contact
Contact.description: Contact represents information to enable communication with an entity, person or organization

customsStatusCode.description: Customs Status Code represents the customs clearance status for the shipment

destinationAirportCode.description: Destination Airport Code prepresents the destination airport associated to the customs status

houseAirWaybillNum.description: House Air Waybill Number is an identifier a bill of lading issued by a freight forwarder for consolidated air freight shipments. It is a contract between the shipper and freight forwarder.

originAirportCode.description: Origin Airport Code represents the origin airport associated to the customs status

piecesCnt.description: Pieces Count is the number of individual pieces of the shipment with the defined status

statusTs.description: Status Timestamp is the timestamp of when the status occured

CustomsStatus.title: CustomsStatus
CustomsStatus.description: Customs Status contains information on the state of customs clearance for a shipment

dangerousGoodsParcels.description: Dangerous Goods Parcels represents the way that the individual dangerous goods are packaged

specialAuthorizationName.description: Special Authorization Name identifies the type of special authorization.  Ex: "Competent Authorization","Explosive Authorization"

specialAuthorizationNum.description: Special Authorization Number identifies the specific special authorization that was granted.  Alphanumeric, Maximum of 15 characters.  Max 4 characters for "Special Provision".  Ex: "APSQ"

DangerousGoods.title: DangerousGoods
DangerousGoods.description: Dangerous Goods contains information on any hazardous materials that are included in the shipment

classNum.description: Class Number identifies the dangerous goods class.  Dangerous goods are divided into nine classes (in addition to several subcategories) on the basis of the specific chemical characteristics producing the risk.  Ex: 4.3

packingGroupCode.description: Packing Group Code is used for the purpose of determining the degree of protective packaging required for dangerous goods during transportation:  Group I: great danger, and most protective packaging required. Some combinations of different classes of dangerous goods on the same vehicle or in the same container are forbidden if one of the goods is Group I.  Group II: medium danger  Group III: minor danger among regulated goods, and least protective packaging within the transportation requirement

packingInstructionsNum.description: Packing Instructions Number is a number that references the appropriate packing instructions document.  It identifies the packaging requirements for the DG.

piecesCnt.description: Pieces count is the number of individual pieces of these dangerous goods

quantityCategoryName.description: Quantity Category is related to the quantity of DG and identifies if the DG shipment is fully regulated or falls into a lesser category. Ex: "Fully Regulated Packaging"

unNum.description: UN numbers (United Nations numbers) are four-digit numbers that identify hazardous materials, and articles (such as explosives, flammable liquids, oxidizers, toxic liquids, etc.) in the framework of international transport. May also be an ID number: Substances with an ID number are associated with proper shipping names recognized by the ICAO Technical Instructions.  ID 8000, Consumer commodity does not have a UN or NA number, and is classed as a Class 9 hazardous material. Ex: \"UN3481\", \"ID8000\"

unNumDescriptionText.description: UN Number Description is a textual description of the dangerous goods represented by the UN number.  Ex: "Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment including lithium ion polymer batteries"

unNumShortDescriptionText.description: UN Number Short Description is a shortened textual description of the dangerous goods represented by the UN number.  Ex: "Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment"

DangerousGoodsItems.title: DangerousGoodsItems
DangerousGoodsItems.description: Dangerous Goods Items identify the number of pieces, quantity, type, and packaging requirements of dangerous goods

dangerousGoodsItemsList.description: Dangerous Goods Items List represents an array of dangerous goods items.

packagingTypeCode.description: Packaging Type Code identifies how the dangerous goods are packaged:  APIO = All Packed in One: One package/container contains all of the listed dangerous goods.  Overpack = There are multiple items wrapped together or containerized, each of which contain the listed dangerous goods.  Loose = Each dangerous item is packaged separately

DangerousGoodsParcel.title: DangerousGoodsParcel
DangerousGoodsParcel.description: Dangerous Goods Parcel represents a grouping within a dangerous goods shipment and the way that the individual dangerous goods are packaged.  Can represent loose, APIO, or an overpack.

currencyCode.description: Currency Code identifies a medium of exchange which allows for the translation of different-valued denominations of money across the world. Example: USD=US Dollar (ISO 4217 format)

declaredValueAmt.description: Declared Value Amount is the declared value of the shipment.  Available for both domestic and international shipments.

insuranceAmt.description: Insurance Amount is the insured value of the shipment.  Available only for international shipments.

DeclaredValueAndInsuranceRequest.title: DeclaredValueAndInsuranceRequest
DeclaredValueAndInsuranceRequest.description: Declared Value and Insurance Request represents the information needed to apply declared value and add insurance to a quote

currencyCode.description: Currency Code identifies a medium of exchange which allows for the translation of different-valued denominations of money across the world. Example: USD=US Dollar (ISO 4217 format)

declaredValueAmt.description: Declared Value Amount is the declared value of the shipment.  Available for both domestic and international shipments.

insuranceAmt.description: Insurance Amount is the insured value of the shipment.  Available only for international shipments.

quoteId.description: Quote Identifier is the identifier for the quote on which the insurance is based

DeclaredValueAndInsuranceServiceQuote.title: DeclaredValueAndInsuranceServiceQuote
DeclaredValueAndInsuranceServiceQuote.description: Declared Value and Insurance Service Quote identifies the type, value, and cost of declared value and insurance in relation to an existing quote

actualDeliveryVehiclePositions.description: Actual Delivery Vehicle Positions is an array of vehicle position.

deliveryVehicleColorText.description: Delivery Vehicle Color Text identifies the color of the delivery vehicle. Ex: "Silver"

deliveryVehicleDesc.description: Delivery Vehicle Description identifies the type of delivery vehicle. Ex: "Ford Transit"

waypointGeographicCoordinates.description: Waypoints Geographic Coordinates is the 2D model of the route with respect to latitude, longitude.

DeliveryVehicleGeographicPosition.title: DeliveryVehicleGeographicPosition
DeliveryVehicleGeographicPosition.description: Delivery Vehicle Geographic Position provides various geographic location coordinates information for the delivery vehicle.

dayCnt.description: Day Count is used to denote the day count of the duration.

hourCnt.description: Hour Count is used to denote the hour count of the duration.

minuteCnt.description: Minute Count is used to denote the minute count of the duration.

Duration.title: Duration
Duration.description: Duration represents various time measures such as day, hour, and minute.

developerMessage.description: Error message that has meaning for the API developer/consumer

message.description: The error message specifiying the details of the error

moreInfo.description: The list of all errors of this type, usefull mostly when multiple fields are concerned

Error.title: Error
Error.description: Error describes information about any problem processing a request

humanRemains.description: Human Remains represents information about the packaging of the remains and escort, if applicable

shipmentSubTypeCode.description: Shipment Subtype Code identifies the sub-category of the shipment.  Ex: 'Dog', 'Cat', 'Child', or 'Adult'

shipmentTypeCode.description: Shipment Type Code identifies the category of the shipment.  Ex: 'PET' or 'HumanRemains'

ExtendedCharacteristics.title: ExtendedCharacteristics
ExtendedCharacteristics.description: Extended Characteristics represents additional data needed for certain shipments like household pets and human remains

filterName.description: Filter Name is the dot-notated name of the field that should be used as a filter for the subscription.  Ex(for shipment goods status events): "goodsStatus.piecesStatusCode"

filterValueText.description: Filter Value Text is the value of the field identified by Filter Name, used to filter the results of the subscription.  Ex: "GOODS ACCEPTED"

actualAircraftPositions.description: Actual Aircraft Positions is the 3D Model for the location of the aircraft is at actually and it represents the values in latitude, longitude and altitude.

waypointGeographicCoordinates.description: Waypoints Geographic Coordinates is the 2D model of the route with respect to latitude, longitude.

FlightLegGeographicPosition.title: FlightLegGeographicPosition
FlightLegGeographicPosition.description: Flight Leg Geographic Position provides various geographic location coordinates information for a flight leg.

latitudeDegreeNum.description: Latitude Degree Number specifies the latitude in degrees. Ex: 45.4085

longitudeDegreeNum.description: Longitude Degree Number specifies the longitude in degrees. Ex: -118.242578

GeographicCoordinate.title: GeographicCoordinate
GeographicCoordinate.description: Geographic Coordinate defines a location on earth for a particular location.

airportCode.description: Airport Code represents the airport associated to the goods status

containerId.description: Container Identifier represents the container that the pieces were associated with at the time of the status

personOrCompanyName.description: Person or Company Name is a person or company associated with the event.  Ex: for the delivery event, this would be the name of the driver or company that picked up the shipment at destination

piecesCnt.description: Pieces Count is the number of individual pieces of the shipment with the defined status

piecesStatusCode.description: Pieces Status Code represents the status of the pieces.  Ex: "GOODS ACCEPTED"

postalCode.description: Postal Code is used to identify the location of a door-to-door pick-up or delivery event

statusTs.description: Status Timestamp is the timestamp of when the status occured

transportDestinationAirportCode.description: Transportation Destination Airport Code represents the destination airport of the flight or truck

transportId.description: Transport Identifier is the flight or truck number if the status is related to a flight or truck. Ex: "DL1234"

transportTs.description: Transport Timestamp represents the departure or arrival timestamp for the flight or truck if the status is related to a flight or truck in ISO 8601 format, Ex: "2020-05-13T24:01:01Z", "2020-05-13T24:01:01-06:00"

weightQty.description: Weight Quantity is the weight of the pieces of the shipment with the defined status

weightUnitCode.description: Weight Unit Code identifies the unit of weight.

GoodsStatus.title: GoodsStatus
GoodsStatus.description: Goods Status represents the state of a portion of a shipment at a particular moment in time

gpsQty.description: GPS Quantity is the number of GPS devices added to the quote

quoteId.description: Quote Identifier is the identifier for the quote on which the add-on is based

GpsDeviceQuoteResponse.title: GpsDeviceQuoteResponse
GpsDeviceQuoteResponse.description: GPS Device Quote Response contains the GPS service quote details

gpsQty.description: GPS Quantity is the number of GPS device quantity needed to apply on quote

GpsDeviceRequest.title: GpsDeviceRequest
GpsDeviceRequest.description: GPS Device Request contains the criteria needed to provide a GPS device quote

airContainerTypeCode.description: Air Container Type Code identifies how the remains are packaged for transport.  Ex: "Air Tray", "Casket"

bodyEmbalmed.description: Body Embalmed is set to true if the remains have been embalmed

containsGelPacks.description: Contains Gel Packs is set to true if the package contains gel packs

humanRemainsTypeCode.description: Human Remains Type Code identifies the characteristics of the Human Remains transport.  Ex: "Adult", "Child/Infant", "Cremated Remains"

HumanRemains.title: HumanRemains
HumanRemains.description: The Human Remains object contains information about the packaging of the remains and escort, if applicable

bookingConfirmationNum.description: Booking confirmation Number for the flight on which the escort is travelling

escortName.description: Escort Name is the name of the person who is serving as escort

escortType.description: Escort Type is the type of the person who is serving as escort

flightDate.description: Flight Date is the flight date for the flight on which the escort is travelling

flightNum.description: Flight Number is the flight number for the flight on which the escort is travelling

paymentInformationText.description: Payment Information Text identifies the payment information of the person who is serving as escort.  Example: "Credit Card"

phoneNum.description: Phone Number is used to contact the person who is serving as escort

HumanRemainsEscort.title: HumanRemainsEscort
HumanRemainsEscort.description: Human Remains Escort contains information about a person who is escorting human remains.

cassCode.description: CASS Code is the the IATA Cargo Account Settlement Systems account identifier

iataCode.description: IATA Code is the International Air Transport Association identifier for the CASS account.

IataCassAccount.title: IataCassAccount
IataCassAccount.description: IATA CASS Account is used to identify an account in the International Air Transport Association Cargo Accounts Settlement System

aircraftBodyTypeExclusionCode.description: Aircraft Body Type Exclusion Code represents any type of aircraft that should be excluded when generating routes.  Ex: "NARROW" for narrow body aircraft.

destinationAirportCode.description: Destination Airport Code is the location where a journey ends. EX: DTW

maximumConnectionPointsCnt.description: Maximum Connection Points Count is the maximum number of connections between origin and destination. Ex: 1

originAirportCode.description: Origin Airport Code is the location from where a journey begins. Ex: ATL

routeSegments.description: Route Segements are the transportation segments of the route from carrier station to carrier station.

Itinerary.title: Itinerary
Itinerary.description: Itinerary is the planned route or journey defined by origin, destination, any preferred transit points, and excluded aircraft types.

httpMethodCode.description: HTTP Method Code is the HTTP method to use when invoking the provided URL

relationId.description: Relation Identifier is represents the identifier of the resource or action represented by the link.  Ex: "trackingDevices"

urlText.description: URL Text is the URL to invoke to perform the action or retreieve the related resource

Link.title: Link
Link.description: Link defines an additional action or resource related to the requested action or resource.  For example, a shipment resource may have a link to the tracking devices for the shipment

locationCode.description: Location Code is the identifier for the location. Ex: NYC

locationName.description: Location Name is the name of the place or area. Ex: New York City

locationTypeCode.description: Location Type Code represents the type of place or area.  Ex: CITY

Location.title: Location
Location.description: Location represents a physical place or area

heightQty.description: Height Quantity is the height of each piece

lengthQty.description: Length Quantity is the length of each piece

piecesCnt.description: Pieces Quantity is the number of loose pieces

stackable.description: Stackable is set to true if other items be placed on top of this one

turnable.description: Turnable is set to true if this item can rest on any side

weightPerPieceQty.description: Weight Per Piece Quantity is the weight of each piece

widthQty.description: Width Quantity is the width of each piece

LooseItem.title: LooseItem
LooseItem.description: Loose Item represents the characteristics of a portion of a shipment that is not enclosed within a container for the purposes of a quote or booking

measurementQty.description: Measurement Quantity is a number representing the measured value with units specified by measurementUnitCode

measurementUnitCode.description: Measurement Unit Code defines the units that apply to the quantity.  Ex: "KG", "LB", "L"

Measurement.title: Measurement
Measurement.description: Measurement is used to define a unit of measure and the associated quantity

detailText.description: explaination of the problem, why it happened, how to solve, instance specific

instanceText.description: linked to detail, URI to human readable description related to the problem instance

message.description: The error instance message describing the error

MoreInfo.title: MoreInfo
MoreInfo.description: More Info provides additional detail on an error

aeoNum.description: Authorized Economic Operator Number is the World Customs Organization AEO number for the participant

airportCode.description: Airport Code is the identification code of the airport associated with the participant

contactPersonName.description: Contact Person Name is the full name of the person who is the point of contact for the participant

contactPersonPhoneNum.description: Contact Person Phone Number is the phone number for the person who is the point of contact for the participant

identificationCode.description: Identification Code represents a means of identification for the participant

identificationTypeCode.description: Identification Type Code specifies what type of identification is used by the participant.  Accepted values: "Unified Social Credit Code" (of the company), "Organization Code" (of the company), "Registered ID Code" (of shipper/consignee), "Personal Social ID", "Passport ID", "Other Personal ID"

participantId.description: Participant ID uniquely identifies a participant.

roleCode.description: Role Code represents the role of the participant on a cargo shipment. Ex: AGENT

Participant.title: Participant
Participant.description: Participant represents a person, entity, or organization that plays a role on a shipment

firstName.description: First Name specifies the given name of a person. Ex: John

lastName.description: Last Name specifies the family name of a person. Ex: Doe

PersonName.title: PersonName
PersonName.description: Person Name represents the given and family name of a person.

customCarrierHeightQty.description: Custom Carrier Height Quantity is the height of the pet carrier. Required if the petCarrierSeriesCode is CUSTOM

customCarrierLengthQty.description: Custom Carrier Length Quantity is the length of the pet carrier. Required if the petCarrierSeriesCode is CUSTOM

customCarrierWeightQty.description: Custom Carrier Weight Quantity is the weight of the pet carrier. Optional if the petCarrierSeriesCode is CUSTOM.

customCarrierWidthQty.description: Custom Carrier Width Quantity is the width of the pet carrier. Required if the petCarrierSeriesCode is CUSTOM

petBreedName.description: Pet Breed Name represents the breed of the household pet.  Ex: 'Russel Terrier', 'Dachshund'

petCarrierQuantity.description: Pet Carrier Quantity is the number of carriers.

petCarrierSeriesCode.description: Pet Carrier Series Code represents the size and type of pet carrier.  Dimensions (Inches): * 100: L:21 W:16 H:15 * 200: L:28 W:20.5 H:21.5 * 300: L:32 W:22.5 H:24 * 300-POD: L:33.4 W:25 H:26.1 (CarePod See: https://www.deltacargo.com/Cargo/catalog/products/pets) * 400: L:36 W:25 H:27 * 500: L:40 W:27 H:30 * 700: L:48 W:32 H:35

petQuantity.description: Pet Quantity is the number of pets of identical characteristics.

petWeightQty.description: Pet Weight Quanity is the weight of the pet(s)

petWeightUnitCode.description: Pet Weight Unit Code identifies the unit of weight.

PetCharacteristics.title: PetCharacteristics
PetCharacteristics.description: Pet Characteristics identifies the breed and size/type of carrier for the pet

charges.description: Charges describes the cost of the pick-up and/or delivery service

deliveryInstructionsText.description: Delivery Instructions Text is free text describing any additional instructions for the delivery driver

deliveryTs.description: Delivery Timestamp is the time that the shipment is scheduled to be delivered

knownShipper.description: Known Shipper should be set to true if the shipper is registered with the United States Transport Security Administration

pickUpInstructionsText.description: Pick-up Intstructions is free text describing any additional instructions for the pick-up driver

pickUpTs.description: Pick-Up Timestamp is the time that the shipment is scheduled be picked up

quoteId.description: Quote Identifier is the identifier for the quote on which the pick-up/delivery service is based

PickupDeliveryQuote.title: PickupDeliveryQuote
PickupDeliveryQuote.description: Pick-Up Delivery Quote contains the Pick Up Delivery Request details and the scheduled pick-up and delivery times, and the associated charges

deliveryInstructionsText.description: Delivery Instructions Text is free text describing any additional instructions for the delivery driver

knownShipper.description: Known Shipper should be set to true if the shipper is registered with the United States Transport Security Administration

pickUpInstructionsText.description: Pick-up Intstructions is free text describing any additional instructions for the pick-up driver

PickupDeliveryRequest.title: PickupDeliveryRequest
PickupDeliveryRequest.description: Pick Up Delivery Request contains the criteria needed to provide a pick-up and/or delivery quote or add pick-up and/or delivery service

deliveryTs.description: Delivery Timestamp is the time that the shipment is scheduled be delivered at destination (Cargo facility for the first mile or customer address for the final mile)

driverInstructionsText.description: Pick-up Intstructions is free text describing any additional instructions for the pick-up driver

knownShipper.description: Known Shipper should be set to true if the shipper is registered with the United States Transport Security Administration

pickUp.description: Pick Up is set to true if this is a pick-up segment.  False if it is a delivery segment.

pickUpDeliveryBookingReferenceId.description: Pick-Up Delivery Booking Reference Identifier is the pick-up delivery vendor's booking reference id

pickUpDeliveryBookingStatusCode.description: Pick-Up Delivery Booking Status Code is the pick-up delivery vendor's booking status code

pickUpDeliveryVendorName.description: Pick-Up Delivery Vendor is the name of the vendor that is providing the pick-up or devlivery service. Ex: Roadie

pickUpTs.description: Pick-Up Timestamp is the time that the shipment is scheduled be picked up at origin (customer address for the first mile or cargo facility for the final mile)

PickupDeliverySegment.title: PickupDeliverySegment
PickupDeliverySegment.description: Pickup Delivery Segment represents pick-up from shipper at origin station and/or delivery to final destination address at destination station

charges.description: Charges are the cost of services billed to a customer and the criteria that is used to determine those costs

subTotalAmt.description: Sub Total Amount is the sum of the individual charges

Price.title: Price
Price.description: Price is a collection of individual charges and the sub-total for that collection of charges

currencyCode.description: Currency Code identifies a medium of exchange which allows for the translation of different-valued denominations of money across the world. Example: USD=US Dollar (ISO 4217 format)

totalAmt.description: Total Amount is the sum of all freight charges, other charges and surcharges

Pricing.title: Pricing
Pricing.description: Pricing represents the currency and charges for a quote or booking

commodityCode.description: Commodity Code represents the classification of the goods being transported. Ex: "0199"

commodityLabelText.description: Commodity Label Text is the human readable name of the commodity.  Ex: "Domestic warm blooded pet"

productCode.description: Product Code represents a product, used in combination with special handling codes.  Example: DSH

productLabelText.description: Product Label Text is the human readable name of the product represented by the product code.  Example: DASH

serviceLevelCode.description: Service Level Code identifies the level of service provided by the product.  Ex: "STANDARD"

specialHandlingCodes.description: Special Handling Codes describe specific handling required. Ex: AVI=Live Animal, PER=Perishable

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Product represents the type of service provided for a cargo booking.

basisCode.description: Basis Code represents the charge basis code. Ex: CHARGEABLE_WEIGHT

basisQty.description: Basis Quantity represents the charge basis quantity

chargeAmt.description: Charge Amount represents the charge amount as determined by the rate amount applied to the unit basis

chargeCode.description: Charge Code represents the charge code

chargeDesc.description: Charge Description is a textual description of the charge

currencyCode.description: Currency Code identifies a medium of exchange which allows for the translation of different-valued denominations of money across the world. Example: USD=US Dollar (ISO 4217 format)

loadTypeCode.description: Load Type Code represents the load type. Ex: Bulk

paymentLocationCode.description: Payment Location Code represents where payment is made. Ex: Origin

paymentMethodCode.description: Payment Method Code represents the payment method type. Ex: Debit

rateAmt.description: Rate Amount represents the rate that is applied to the unit basis in order to determine a charge.

rateId.description: Rate Id uniquely identifies a rate

unitCode.description: Unit Code represents the unit measure. Ex: FLAT

PublishedCharge.title: PublishedCharge
PublishedCharge.description: Published Charge represents the published cost of a service billed to a customer and the criteria that is used to determine that cost.  May be different from the actual charge if a contract, promo, spot, or manual rate is applicable.

expirationTs.description: Expiration Timestamp is date and time at which the quote is no longer valid in ISO 8601 format, Ex: "2020-05-13T24:01:01Z", "2020-05-13T24:01:01-06:00"

links.description: Links defines additional actions or resources related to the requested action or resource.

quoteId.description: Quote Identifier is a unique identifier for the quote

Quote.title: Quote
Quote.description: Quote represents an option for booking a cargo shipment

dropOffTs.description: Drop Off Timestamp is the time that the shipment will be dropped off at the airport in ISO 8601 format, Ex: "2020-05-13T24:01:01Z", "2020-05-13T24:01:01-06:00"

knownShipper.description: Known Shipper should be set to true if the shipper is registered with the United States Transport Security Administration

latestArrivalTs.description: Latest Arrival Timestamp is the time by which the shipment must arrive at destination in ISO 8601 format, Ex: "2020-05-13T24:01:01Z", "2020-05-13T24:01:01-06:00"

participants.description: Participant represents a person, entity, or organization that plays a role on a shipment

priceOnly.description: Price only indicates whether to price without a route generation. The default value is false. If true then the routeSegments within the itinerary must be defined.

products.description: Products represent the type of service requested

quoteLimitQty.description: Quote Limit Quantity limits the number of quotes produced to the value specified.

QuotesRequest.title: QuotesRequest
QuotesRequest.description: Quotes Request contains the information needed in order to request possible options for booking

quotes.description: Quotes is a list of quotes, each representing an option that a customer can use to create a booking

transactionId.description: TransactionId is an identifier for the request that generated the quotes.  Generated by the API, and can be used to retrieve the quotes that were generated with this request.

QuotesResponse.title: QuotesResponse
QuotesResponse.description: Quotes Response holds a list of quotes and the transaction id for the request that generated the quotes. Quotes are valid for 30 minutes and do not need to be deleted if unused.

airWaybillNum.description: Air Waybill Number is an identifier for a shipment that is unique for the life of a shipment. Ex: 00612345678

customsStatus.description: Customs Status contains information on the state of customs clearance for a shipment

goodsCurrentStatus.description: Goods Current Status is a detailed status of all portions of the shipment

goodsEvents.description: Goods events is contains a historical list of all changes in goods status for the shipment

links.description: Links define related resources and actions for the shipment

overallStatusCode.description: Overall Status Code is a summarized status for the shipment

participants.description: Participants represents people, entities or organizations that play a role on the shipment

shipmentEvents.description: Shipment Events represents the state of a portion of a shipment at a particular moment in time

Shipment.title: Shipment
Shipment.description: Shipment represents the details of a shipment and the current state of any goods that have been accepted

bupContainers.description: BUP (Bulk Utilization Program) Container represents shipper loaded containers which are transported intact by the carrier

chargeableWeightQty.description: Chargeable Weight Quantity identifies the weight of the shipment that is chargeable.  Calculated by the carrier.

dimensionalWeightQty.description: Dimensional Weight Quantity identifies an alternate weight based on the dimensions of the shipment. Calculated by the carrier.

electronicAirWaybill.description: Electronic Air Way Bill identifies whether the shipmenmt is utilizing an electronic air waybill document

extendedCharacteristics.description: Extended Characteristics represents additional data needed for certain shipments like household pets and human remains

handlingRemarkText.description: Handling Remark Text is free text field for information to assist in the handling of the shipment

looseItems.description: Loose Items represents the characteristics of the portions of a shipment that are not enclosed within a container

shipmentDesc.description: Shipment Description is a free text description of the contents of the shipment

shipmentSecurityStatusCode.description: Shipment Security Status Code represents the security status for the shipment.  Ex: NOS

totalPiecesQty.description: Total Pieces Quantity is the total number of loose pieces and containers for the shipment

totalVolumeQty.description: Total Volume Quantity is the total volume of the shipment

totalWeightQty.description: Total Weight Quantity identifies the total weight of the shipment

ShipmentCharacteristics.title: ShipmentCharacteristics
ShipmentCharacteristics.description: Shipment Characteristics identifies the physical characteristics of the shipment

airWaybillPrefixCode.description: Air Waybill Prefix Code is a three digit number identifying the carrier

estimatedAvailabilityTs.description: Estimated Availibility Timestamp is the time that the shipment is expected to be available at destination

latestAcceptanceTs.description: Latest Acceptance Timestamp is the latest time that the shipment can be received by the carrier

pickupDeliverySegments.description: Pickup Delivery Segment represents pick-up from shipper at origin station and/or delivery to final destination address at destination station.

routeSegments.description: Route Segements are the transportation segments of the route from carrier station to carrier station

ShipmentRouting.title: ShipmentRouting
ShipmentRouting.description: Shipment Routing defines how a cargo shipment will be transported

filters.description: Filters represents an array of filter

resourceName.description: Resource Name is the name of the rest resource or sub-resource that is subscribed.  For example: bookings, shipments.events

subscriptionId.description: Subscription ID is a unique identifier for the subscription that is generated by the API.

targets.description: Targets represents an array of target

Subscription.title: Subscription
Subscription.description: Subscription identifies the resource being subscribed, any filters to be applied to the resource, and the target where notifications should be sent

filters.description: Filters represents an array of filter

resourceName.description: Resource Name is the name of the rest resource or sub-resource that is subscribed.  For example: bookings, shipments.events

targets.description: Targets represents an array of target

SubscriptionRequest.title: SubscriptionRequest
SubscriptionRequest.description: Subscription Request identifies the resource being subscribed, any filters to be applied to the resource, and the target where notifications should be sent

targetText.description:
Target Text identifies the specific target. For email, it is the email address. For WEBHOOK it is a JSON string containing the details needed to send notifications to your webhook service endpoint.

Ex (EMAIL): john.doe@delta.com
Email notifications will be in the form of a formatted email

Ex (WEBHOOK):
oauth2 is optional. If provided, the token url will be invoked in order to obtain an access token to be passed in the "Authorization" header in the call to your webhook url.

header is optional. If your service requires any specific headers they may be identified by populating the headers list.

The webhook url will be invoked as a POST with the body of the request containing the API resource object model identified by the resourceName for the subscription. 
{
   "oauth2":{
     "tokenUrl":"https://your.oauth2.token.path/",
     "clientId":"xxxxxxxxxx",
     "clientSecret":"xxxxxxxxxx"
   },
   "webhookUrl":"https://your.service.path/",
   "headers":[
     {
       "key":"key_name",
       "value":"key_value"
     }
   ]
 }

targetTypeCode.description: Target Type Code identifies the type of nofication to generate.  Supported options: EMAIL, WEBHOOK

Target.title: Target
Target.description: Target identifies where notifications for a subscription should be sent

containerQty.description: Container Quantity represents the total quantity of the container. Ex: 3

temperatureControlledContainerType.description: Temperature Controlled Container Type identifies the supplier and type of temperature controlled container

TemperatureControlledContainer.title: TemperatureControlledContainer
TemperatureControlledContainer.description: Temperature Controlled Container represents a container that is insulated or actively temperature controlled

availableDeliveryHoursText.description: Available Delivery Hours describes the hours of the day that the container can be delivered Ex: 9am-5pm

containerContentsDesc.description: Container Contents Description is free text describing the contents of the container.  If pharma, this should describe the type of pharma.

customerPickup.description: Customer Pickup represents whether container will be picked up from the supplier by customer or not

deliveryAttentionText.description: Delivery Attention Text, if supplier is delivering the container to the customer

leaseCustomerName.description: Lease Customer Name Identifies the customer of the container.

leaseEmailAdr.description: Lease Email Address represents the email address for the customer.

leaseForwarderName.description: Lease Forwarder Name for the container

leasePhoneNum.description: Lease Phone Number represents the contact number for the customer.

leaseShipperName.description: Lease Shipper Name is the name of the shipper for the container.

leaseStartDate.description: Lease Start Date represents the starting date of the container leasing

specialInstructionText.description: Special Instruction Text is free text additional special instructions defined by the customer

supplierName.description: Supplier Name is the name of the supplier for the temperature controlled container.

TemperatureControlledContainerLease.title: TemperatureControlledContainerLease
TemperatureControlledContainerLease.description: Temperature Controlled Container Lease contains information about the lease of one or more temperature controlled containers from a single supplier.

quoteId.description: Quote Identifier is the unique identifier for the associated shipment quote.

temperatureControlledContainerCharges.description: Temperature Controlled Container Charges contain the rate and total charges for the temperature controlled containers

TemperatureControlledContainerQuote.title: TemperatureControlledContainerQuote
TemperatureControlledContainerQuote.description: Temperature Controlled Container Quote identifies the charges for the requested temperature controlled containers in relation to a shipment quote

temperatureControlledContainer.description: Temperature Controlled Container represents one or more containers that are insulated or actively temperature controlled.

temperatureControlledContainerLeases.description: Temperature Controlled Container Leases contains information about the lease of one or more temperature controlled containers from a single supplier.   Exactly one entry must be included for each distinct supplier of one or more containers in temperatureControlledContainer[]

TemperatureControlledContainerRequest.title: TemperatureControlledContainerRequest
TemperatureControlledContainerRequest.description: Temperature Controlled Container Request contains the criteria needed to provide a quote on a temperature controlled containers or to add temperature controlled containers to a shipment quote

trackingDeviceEvents.description: Tracking Device Event represent a the data that the tracking device has captured and the timestamp of the captured data

trackingDeviceId.description: Tracking Device Identifier is a unique key for a tracking device

TrackingDevice.title: TrackingDevice
TrackingDevice.description: Tracking Device represents a piece of electronic equipment that is able to record and report statistics about the state of a piece of a shipment

airPressureNum.description: Air Pressure Number is the ambiesnt air pressure, in Pascals, captured by the tracking device. Ex: 101325

batteryPercentNum.description: Battery Percent Number represents the remaining percentage of battery capacity. Ex: 97.86

eventTs.description: Event timestamp is the time that the tracking event occured in ISO 8601 format, Ex: "2020-05-13T24:01:01Z", "2020-05-13T24:01:01-06:00"

humidityPercentNum.description: Humidity Percent Number is the relative humidity, in percent, captured by the tracking device. Ex: 65.4

infraredPercentNum.description: Infrared Percent Number is the percentage of infrared light exposure captured by the tracking device. Ex: 85.3

lightPercentNum.description: Light Percent Number is the percentage of visible light exposure captured by the tracking device. Ex: 85.3

temperatureCentigradeNum.description: Temperature Centigrade Number is the ambient temperature captured by the tracking device in degrees centigrade. Ex: 31.5

temperatureProbeCentigradeNum.description: Temperature Probe Centigrade Number is the ambient temperature captured by the tracking device's temperature probe in degrees centigrade. Ex: 31.5

voltageNum.description: Voltage Number is the voltage captured by the tracking device, in milivolts. Ex: 4134

TrackingDeviceEvent.title: TrackingDeviceEvent
TrackingDeviceEvent.description: Tracking Device Event represent a the data that the tracking device has captured and the timestamp of the captured data

equipmentTypeCode.description: Equipment Type Code identifies the type of aircraft or truck. Ex: 717, TRK

marketingCarrierCode.description: Marketing Carrier Code identifies the carrier selling the flight or truck

operatingCarrierCode.description: Operating Carrier Code identifies the carrier that is operating the flight or truck

serviceTypeCode.description: Service Type Code identifies the mode of transportation for the transportation segment

TransportMeans.title: TransportMeans
TransportMeans.description: Transport Means identifies the mode and carrier of transportation

deliveryVehicleGeographicPositions.description: Delivery Vehicle Geographic Positions represents an array of delivery vehicle geographic position.

flightLegGeographicPositions.description: Flight Leg Geographic Position represents the leg information related to a flight.

TransportPosition.title: TransportPosition
TransportPosition.description: Transport Position describes the geographic location of the shipment while in transport, including the current, past, and planned location

allotmentId.description: Allotment Identifier represents the allotment, if utilizing an allotment on the segment

allotmentName.description: Allotment Name is the name of the allotment, if utilizing an allotment on the segment

arrivalTs.description: Arrival Timestamp is the arrival date and time of the transport segment in ISO 8601 format, Ex: "2020-05-13T24:01:01Z", "2020-05-13T24:01:01-06:00"

bookingStatusCode.description: Booking Status Code represents the booking status of the shipment on this segement

carbonEmissionWeightQty.description: Cargo Emmision Weight Quantity is an estimate of the weight of carbon emission produced by transporting the shipment

departureTs.description: Departure Timestamp is the departure date and time of the transport segment in ISO 8601 format, Ex: "2020-05-13T24:01:01Z", "2020-05-13T24:01:01-06:00"

sequenceNum.description: Sequence Number identifies the order of the segment in the routing

transportId.description: Transport Identifier is the flight or truck number for the transport segment

TransportSegment.title: TransportSegment
TransportSegment.description: Transport Segment is the operation of a means of transport with a single identifier between the point where a shipment first boards an aircraft or truck and the point where it is unloaded.

baseTypeCode.description: Base Type Code defines whether the container is a lower deck container (LDC), lower deck pallet (LDP), or main deck pallet (MDP).

subTypeCode.description: Sub Type Code identifies the ULD sub type.  Example: LD2, LD3, LD4

UldType.title: UldType
UldType.description: ULD (Unit Load Device) Type identifies a specific class of container

dimensionUnitCode.description: Dimension Unit Code identifies the unit of length used for length, width, and height

volumeUnitCode.description: Volume Unit Code identifies the unit of volume.

weightUnitCode.description: Weight Unit Code identifies the unit of weight.

UnitsOfMeasure.title: UnitsOfMeasure
UnitsOfMeasure.description: Units of Measure identifies the dimension, weight, and volume units used for measurements

currentTimeMillisecondCnt.description: Current Time Millisecond Count represents the time in milliseconds.

VehiclePosition.title: VehiclePosition
VehiclePosition.description: Vehicle Position indicates the position of the vehicle with respect to various parameters.
